questions.stem: Which Indian player was described as the toughest batter faced by England pacer Mark Wood?
questions.explanation: Mark Wood named Rohit Sharma as the toughest batter he faced, choosing him over Virat Kohli. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

questions.stem: Which Indian athlete created history as only the first doubles pair to reach world No. 1 ranking and win an Asian Games badminton gold?
questions.explanation: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty became the first Indian men’s doubles to reach world No. 1 and won gold at Asian Games. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

questions.stem: Which sport’s inaugural World Cup was hosted by India in 2025 at Indira Gandhi Indoor Stadium?
questions.explanation: India hosted the inaugural Kho Kho World Cup in January 2025 in New Delhi. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

questions.stem: Which Indian weightlifter won the gold medal in the women's 48-kg category at the Commonwealth Weightlifting Championships 2025?
questions.explanation: Mirabai Chanu won gold in the women’s 48 kg event with a record total of 193 kg at the 2025 Commonwealth Weightlifting Championships. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

questions.stem: Which state emerged as overall champion at the Khelo India Water Sports event in J&K in 2025 with 10 golds?
questions.explanation: Madhya Pradesh topped the medal tally with 18 medals (10 golds) at the Khelo India Water Sports event. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}

questions.stem: Which surprising IPL incident from 2008 resurfaced in 2025 via unseen footage involving Harbhajan Singh?
questions.explanation: Previously unseen video of the Harbhajan Singh–Sreesanth altercation (slap-gate) surfaced, reigniting debate. :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}

questions.stem: Which group of athletes from UPP brings pride to both sports and policing, including a wrestler and a judoka?
questions.explanation: UP Police athletes like wrestler Priyanshi Prajapat and judoka Asmita Dey excel in law enforcement and sport. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}

questions.stem: Which Indian tennis pair broke into the top ranking and won both the World Tour Super 1000 and a major multi-sport Asian Games gold?
questions.explanation: Rankireddy and Shetty achieved No. 1 ranking and won gold at both Asian Games and Commonwealth Games. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}

questions.stem: Which Commonwealth weightlifter achieved a championship record total of 193 kg in 2025?
questions.explanation: Mirabai Chanu lifted a record 193 kg total in the women's 48 kg category at the Commonwealth Weightlifting Championships. :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}

questions.stem: Which national team did India’s men’s kho kho side defeat to win the inaugural World Cup in 2025?
questions.explanation: India defeated Nepal in the final of the inaugural Kho Kho World Cup in New Delhi. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

questions.stem: Which Indian hockey defender scored over 200 international goals and led India to Olympic bronze in Paris 2024?
questions.explanation: Harmanpreet Singh, a drag-flick specialist, scored 205 goals and captained India to bronze at Paris Olympics. :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

questions.stem: Which Indian golfer made a Guinness World Record for the fastest badminton smash at 565 km/h?
questions.explanation: Satwiksairaj Rankireddy set the fastest smash record at 565 km/h. :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}

questions.stem: Which milestone did Madhya Pradesh achieve at the Khelo India Water Sports festival in Dal Lake?
questions.explanation: MP became champion with 18 medals—including 10 golds—at the festival. :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}

options.text: Top the medal tally with 10 golds

questions.stem: Which athlete earned two bronzes in track athletics (T35 class) at the 2024 Paris Paralympics for India?
questions.explanation: Preethi Pal won bronze in both 100 m and 200 m T35 events in Paris 2024. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}

questions.stem: Which Indian coach award, established in 1985, honours outstanding performance by sports coaches?
questions.explanation: The Dronacharya Award, instituted in 1985, is conferred by the Government of India to honour outstanding coaches in sports. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

questions.stem: Which award, renamed after Major Dhyan Chand in 2021, is India’s highest sporting honour?
questions.explanation: The Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna was renamed the Major Dhyan Chand Khel Ratna Award in 2021 and is India’s highest sporting honour. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

questions.stem: Which lifetime achievement award in Indian sports is named after the legendary hockey player and includes a statuette and memento?
questions.explanation: The Dhyan Chand Award for Lifetime Achievement is named after Major Dhyan Chand and includes a statuette, certificate, ceremonial dress, and cash prize. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

questions.stem: Which state-level award from Madhya Pradesh, introduced in 1990, includes a blazer, tie, and ₹200,000 cash prize?
questions.explanation: The Vikram Award, instituted in 1990 by Madhya Pradesh, includes ₹2,00,000, a blazer, tie, and certificate and is the highest state sports award in MP. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}

questions.stem: Which award for outstanding coaches is named after a character from the Mahabharata?
questions.explanation: The Dronacharya Award is named after Guru Drona (Dronacharya) from the Mahabharata. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
